==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Etymology===
From {{zh-l|西|west}} and {{zh-l|藏|tr=Zàng}}, the latter a transcription of Tibetan {{m|bo|གཙང||a region in Tibet encompassing Gyantse and Shigatse}}. Using this word to refer to Tibet in general was fairly recent {{defdate|from 20th century}}.

The old Chinese words for Tibet were {{zh-l|蕃}}, {{zh-l|土蕃|tr=Tǔbō, Tǔfán}} and {{zh-l|吐蕃|tr=Tǔbō, Tǔfán}}.
